thread.title: New Mural in Oakland Honors Victims of Deadly Warehouse Fire
thread.title_full: New Mural in Oakland Honors Victims of Deadly Warehouse Fire

author: Kevin L. Jones
title: New Mural in Oakland Honors Victims of Deadly Warehouse Fire
text:
A Bay Area street artist recently completed a large mural in Oakland that lists the name of every victim of the deadly warehouse fire that killed 36 people back in December.
On Sunday, Norman “Vogue” Chuck , a graffiti artist living in San Leandro, finished the massive mural on East 12th Street between 22nd and 23rd avenues in Oakland. The piece features a large sailing ship (also known as a galleon) sailing into the sunset, surrounded by doves. The ship is in reference to the name of the venue where the deadly fire occurred, which was at a warehouse space called the Ghost Ship . 
“Honored to paint & dedicate this memorial mural from the tragic Oakland Ghostship fire. For the 36 individuals lost, the survivors, there [sic] family & friends,” Chuck wrote on his Facebook page . 
Jetty Extracts, an Oakland company that manufactures medical cannabis extracts, helped cover the cost of the mural. A representative from Jetty Extracts, Lauren Bunde, told KQED that the company’s employees support mural artists and “feel that this kind of artwork is needed now more than ever.”
At the same time Chuck was painting the Oakland mural, a fellow muralist was painting another Ghost Ship memorial in San Francisco’s Clarion Alley, according to the Mercury News .
